title: Create Your Config
text: adds envsetup:paths search path contains relevant objects needed point different directories environment.

what: Level 1 of config, the infrastructure environment (ex. dev, qa or prod)
title: Create Your Config
text: might relevant , everyone work prod area compute environment. setting environments dev, qa, prod, can use address configuration needs.

what: Level 2 of config, paths and autos
title: Create Your Config
code: default:   paths:   autos:  dev:   paths:   autos:  qa:   paths:   autos:  prod:   paths:   autos:

title: Create Your Config
text: example, now just focus setting one environment, default configuration. wish different configurations based infrastructure environment, need expand fit needs. example, need read data, write results save script future reference project ’ll call project1. need object point locations, add data, output programs objects level 3 config. Let’s create temporary directory store config file _envsetup.yml. can call envsetup::profile() point configuration. now data, output programs available us search path within envsetup:paths. Alright! Now let’s go one step imagine programmer, ’ll call Tidy McVerse. Miss McVerse needs read data data development area started programming. great! already object data points “/demo/DEV/username/project1/data”. Half way programming, data considered production ready data moved “/demo/DEV/username/project1/data” “/demo/PROD/project1/data”. Miss McVerse need change programs now, needs way read data smarter average bear. object uses read data work data “/demo/DEV/username/project1/data” “/demo/PROD/project1/data”. Let’s create config keep Tidy McVerse happy focused results, data locations. data, output programs available us search path within envsetup:paths, data now named list two locations. also now envsetup_environ , get details later, just accept exists now. can use envsetup::read_path() help us find data like read. create directories add mtcars data PROD data directory, “/demo/PROD/project1/data”. Now can use read_path(), passing path object data find read mtcars.RDS. data PROD function returns path PROD mtcars.RDS. Let’s keep going! data DEV PROD? see path DEV now instead path PROD. now can talk envsetup_environ variable set config! multiple paths, data, controls paths checked. just index, wherever environment found list, end checked. DEV first, meaning locations checked object found nothing found. Let’s now add environment PROD. simply change envsetup_environ DEV PROD, DEV wouldn’t work. need add configuration PROD. write new config use . Let’s write envsetup_environ variable check now PROD. ! isn’t PROD. must pass configuration config:get() telling use PROD. Now lets see changed now call read_path() mtcars.RDS using PROD configuration. see path PROD, even though data exists DEV PROD. data indexed starting location PROD, last element data, location checked, excluding DEV.
code: default:   paths:   autos: default:   paths:     data: "/demo/DEV/username/project1/data"     output: "/demo/DEV/username/project1/output"     programs: "/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs" library(envsetup) #>  #> Attaching package: 'envsetup' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     library  dir <- fs::file_temp() dir.create(dir) config_path <- file.path(dir, "_envsetup.yml")  file_conn <- file(config_path) writeLines( "default:   paths:     data: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/data'     output: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'", file_conn) close(file_conn)  envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path)  rprofile(envsetup_config)  unlink(dir, recursive = TRUE) objects("envsetup:paths") #> [1] "data"     "output"   "programs"  data #> [1] "/demo/DEV/username/project1/data" output #> [1] "/demo/DEV/username/project1/output" programs #> [1] "/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs" default:   paths:     data: !expr list(DEV = '/demo/DEV/username/project1/data', PROD = '/demo/PROD/project1/data')     output: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'DEV'); 'DEV' dir <- fs::file_temp() dir.create(dir) config_path <- file.path(dir, "_envsetup.yml")  fileConn <- file(config_path) writeLines(   paste0( "default:   paths:     data: !expr list(DEV = '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/data', PROD = '",dir,"/demo/PROD/project1/data')     output: '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'DEV'); 'DEV'"   ), fileConn) close(fileConn)  envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path)  rprofile(envsetup_config) objects("envsetup:paths") #> [1] "data"             "envsetup_environ" "output"           "programs"  data #> $DEV #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/DEV/username/project1/data" #>  #> $PROD #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/PROD/project1/data" output #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/DEV/username/project1/output" programs #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs" envsetup_environ #> [1] "DEV" dir.create(file.path(dir, "/demo/DEV/username/project1/data"), recursive = TRUE) dir.create(file.path(dir, "/demo/PROD/project1/data"), recursive = TRUE)  saveRDS(mtcars, file.path(dir, "/demo/PROD/project1/data/mtcars.RDS")) read_path(data, "mtcars.RDS") #> Read Path:/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/PROD/project1/data/mtcars.RDS #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/PROD/project1/data/mtcars.RDS" saveRDS(mtcars, file.path(dir, "/demo/DEV/username/project1/data/mtcars.RDS"))  read_path(data, "mtcars.RDS") #> Read Path:/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/DEV/username/project1/data/mtcars.RDS #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/DEV/username/project1/data/mtcars.RDS" default:   paths:     data: !expr list(DEV = '/demo/DEV/username/project1/data', PROD = '/demo/PROD/project1/data')     output: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'DEV'); 'DEV' default:   paths:     data: !expr list(DEV = '/demo/DEV/username/project1/data', PROD = '/demo/PROD/project1/data')     output: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'DEV'); 'DEV'  prod:   paths:     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'PROD'); 'PROD' fileConn <- file(config_path) writeLines(   paste0( "default:   paths:     data: !expr list(DEV = '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/data', PROD = '",dir,"/demo/PROD/project1/data')     output: '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/output'     programs: '",dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/programs'     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'DEV'); 'DEV'  prod:   paths:     envsetup_environ: !expr Sys.setenv(ENVSETUP_ENVIRON = 'PROD'); 'PROD'"   ), fileConn) close(fileConn)  envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path)  rprofile(envsetup_config) envsetup_environ #> [1] "DEV" envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path, config = "prod")  rprofile(envsetup_config)  envsetup_environ #> [1] "PROD" read_path(data, "mtcars.RDS") #> Read Path:/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/PROD/project1/data/mtcars.RDS #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef06585874b/demo/PROD/project1/data/mtcars.RDS"

title: Create Your Config
text: adds multiple environments search path, containing objects automatically sourced. let’s go back Tidy McVerse. created custom, one function stored /demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library. add path autos config. let’s look working example. create directory, config, place script folder, call rprofile() passing config file. Now can see dev_script_library added search path, function test() available within environment, can execute function without need sourcing. earth need ? Just previous data example, scripts can multiple locations qualification lifecycle. let’s say Tidy McVerse’s custom, one function found useful others specific project. function needs move dev folder, /demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library, central prod location, /demo/PROD/project1/script_library. program used function hard-coded source() function, multiple program need updated function move lifecycle. let’s add prod script library config. Now can see prod_script_library added search path, function test() available within environment, can execute function without need sourcing.
code: default:   autos: default:   autos:     dev_script_library: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library' dir <- fs::file_temp() dir.create(dir) config_path <- file.path(dir, "_envsetup.yml")  dir.create(file.path(dir, "/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library"), recursive = TRUE)  # write a function to the folder fileConn <- file(file.path(dir, "/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library/test.R")) writeLines( "test <- function(){print('test')}", fileConn) close(fileConn)  # write the config fileConn <- file(config_path) writeLines(   paste0( "default:   autos:     dev_script_library: '", dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library'"   ), fileConn) close(fileConn)  envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path)  rprofile(envsetup_config) #> Attaching functions from/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef04a921db8/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library to autos:dev_script_library  unlink(dir, recursive=TRUE) search() #>  [1] ".GlobalEnv"               "autos:dev_script_library" #>  [3] "package:envsetup"         "envsetup:paths"           #>  [5] "package:stats"            "package:graphics"         #>  [7] "package:grDevices"        "package:utils"            #>  [9] "package:datasets"         "package:methods"          #> [11] "Autoloads"                "tools:callr"              #> [13] "package:base"  objects("autos:dev_script_library") #> [1] "test"  test() #> [1] "test" default:   autos:     dev_script_library: '/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library'     prod_script_library: '/demo/PROD/project1/script_library' dir <- fs::file_temp() dir.create(dir) config_path <- file.path(dir, "_envsetup.yml")  dir.create(file.path(dir, "/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library"), recursive = TRUE) dir.create(file.path(dir, "/demo/PROD/project1/script_library"), recursive = TRUE)  # write a function to the folder fileConn <- file(file.path(dir, "/demo/PROD/project1/script_library/test.R")) writeLines( "test <- function(){print('test')}", fileConn) close(fileConn)  # write the config fileConn <- file(config_path) writeLines(   paste0( "default:   autos:     dev_script_library: '", dir,"/demo/DEV/username/project1/script_library'     prod_script_library: '", dir,"/demo/PROD/project1/script_library'"   ), fileConn) close(fileConn)  envsetup_config <- config::get(file = config_path)  rprofile(envsetup_config) #> Attaching functions from/tmp/Rtmp0cyoij/filebef01d76be8d/demo/PROD/project1/script_library to autos:prod_script_library  unlink(dir, recursive=TRUE) search() #>  [1] ".GlobalEnv"                "autos:prod_script_library" #>  [3] "package:envsetup"          "envsetup:paths"            #>  [5] "package:stats"             "package:graphics"          #>  [7] "package:grDevices"         "package:utils"             #>  [9] "package:datasets"          "package:methods"           #> [11] "Autoloads"                 "tools:callr"               #> [13] "package:base"  objects("autos:prod_script_library") #> [1] "test"  test() #> [1] "test"

code: @Manual{,   title = {envsetup: Support the Setup of the R Environment for Clinical Trial Programming Workflows},   author = {Nicholas Masel and Mike Stackhouse and Aidan Ceney},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.9000}, }

title: Support the Setup of the R Environment for Clinical Trial Programming Workflows
text: purpose package support setup R environment. two main features : autos automatically source files /directories environment paths consistently set path objects across projects /O implemented using configuration file allow easy, custom configurations can used multiple projects.

title: Support the Setup of the R Environment for Clinical Trial Programming Workflows
Support the Setup of the R Environment for Clinical Trial Programming Workflows
text: Create _envsetup.yml configuration file specify autos paths store centrally. Create update .Rprofile read config call rprofile()
code: library(envsetup)  # read configuration envsetup_config <- config::get(file = "path/to/_envsetup.yml")  # pass configuration to rprofile() to setup the environment rprofile(envsetup_config)
